name: Triangle read by rows: T(n, k) is the number of invertible n X n matrices over GF(2) that can be optimally row-reduced in k steps, n >= 0, k >= 0.
comment: Using transvections as the generating set of the matrix group, this is the number of inequivalent minimal words in k generators; the number of elements at distance k from the identity in the corresponding Cayley graph.
Also the number of different elements that can be represented by minimal quantum circuits of k CNOT gates on n qubits.
link: Søren Fuglede Jørgensen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..83
Marc Bataille, Quantum Circuits of CNOT gates: Optimization and Entanglement, Quantum Information Processing, 21(7):269 (2022)
Jens Emil Christensen, Søren Fuglede Jørgensen, Andreas Pavlogiannis, and Jaco van de Pol, On Exact Sizes of Minimal CNOT Circuits, arXiv:2503.01467 [quant-ph] (2025)
Ketan N. Patel, Igor L. Markov, and John P. Hayes, Optimal synthesis of linear reversible circuits, Quantum Info. Comput., 8(3) (2008), 282-294
example: For n = 2, k = 1, the two matrices are [[1, 1], [0, 1]] and [[1, 0], [1, 1]].
For n = 2, k = 2, the two matrices are [[1, 1], [1, 0]] and [[0, 1], [1, 1]].
For n = 2, k = 3, the only matrix is [[0, 1], [1, 0]].
author: _Søren Fuglede Jørgensen_, Mar 08 2025
